name: Holstein Friesian
description: A breed of dairy cattle known for its high milk production and distinctive black-and-white or red-and-white spotted coat.

name: Angus
description: A breed of beef cattle originating from Scotland, known for its solid black or red coat and high-quality meat production.

name: Hereford
description: A beef cattle breed known for its red body and white face, originally from Herefordshire, England, and prized for its adaptability and meat quality.

name: Jersey
description: A small dairy cattle breed from the island of Jersey, valued for its rich, high-fat-content milk and gentle temperament.

name: Charolais
description: A large French beef cattle breed known for its cream or white coat, rapid growth rate, and lean, high-quality meat.

name: Simmental
description: One of the oldest and most widely distributed cattle breeds, originating from Switzerland, known for its versatility in meat, milk, and draught work.

name: Limousin
description: A French breed of beef cattle, recognized for its golden-red coat, robustness, and excellent meat yield.

name: Brahman
description: A breed originating from India, known for its hump, loose skin, and tolerance to heat and insects, commonly used in tropical regions.

name: Scottish Highland
description: A rugged breed from Scotland, famous for its long horns and thick, shaggy coat, well-suited for harsh climates.

name: Guernsey
description: A dairy cattle breed from the island of Guernsey, known for its rich, golden-yellow milk and distinctive fawn and white coat.

name: Dexter
description: A small, dual-purpose breed originating from Ireland, valued for both milk and meat production, as well as its hardiness.

name: Ayrshire
description: A hardy dairy breed from Scotland, known for its efficient milk production and reddish-brown and white spotted coat.

name: Galloway
description: A heritage Scottish beef breed known for its curly coat, resilience in cold climates, and high-quality marbled meat.

name: Zebu
description: A tropical breed known for its hump, dewlap, and resistance to heat, insects, and diseases, commonly found in South Asia.

name: Red Poll
description: A dual-purpose breed from England, known for its docility, reddish-brown coat, and suitability for both milk and meat production.
